headline.main: From Children to Medicine, a Particular Look at the World; H.M.O.'s: Enemy In Medical Thriller

docs.abstract: Profile of Dr David Shobin, Long Island novelist whose latest medical thriller is The Provider; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: DR. DAVID SHOBIN could not have produced his latest medical thriller, ''The Provider'' (St. Martin s Paperbacks, $6.99), at a more opportune time. Everybody, it seems, has a bone to pick with health maintenance organizations, and it's payback time, says the physician-author, who has published six novels. ''H.M.O.'s are everyone's favorite villain these days,'' said Dr. Shobin, whose practice is in Smithtown. The book's premise, like most of his hospital-based novels, is about a good thing run amok. In this case, it's about the ghoulish steps an unscrupulous insurance company takes in trying to rein in hospital costs. ''It takes place in the University Hospital at Stony Brook only because it's the facility I am most familiar with,'' Dr. Shobin said. ''The horrific nature of what goes on in the novel had nothing to do with the stellar quality of the hospital, I can assure you.
